page.title: 18 Weaverthorpe School
page.content: This was built in{1911}to cater for the{120 children of Helperthorpe, {Weaverthorpe and Butterwick,}aged 5 to about 13. Since{1958}the{over-11}year children have gone first to{Driffield {till 1974}and now to{Norton.}The school now has{20}in the{Upper}and{20 in the{Lower class.}There is a{staff of a{teaching head, 1 full-time {teacher; part-time staff}include:- a teacher, a secretary, a canteen helper, a play-ground assistant and a teacher's assistant. There is now a large room for the {Lower class and library,}the{Upper {classroom,}an{office,}a small kitchen for washing-up, 3 indoor toilets and a store-room. A B.B.C. computer, a small colour television, a radio and a tape recorder are the main pieces of non-traditional equipment.
